newsitem.title: ITALY: IBCA affirms Italy's Cariplo ratings.
newsitem.headline: IBCA affirms Italy's Cariplo ratings.

text.p: European credit rating agency IBCA said it has affirmed credit ratings for Italian savings bank Cariplo as long-term A-Plus and short-term A1.
It said legal and individual ratings for Cariplo, whose full name is Cassa di Risparmio delle Provincie Lombarde, remained unchanged at C and 2.

IBCA said in a statement that while Cariplo had undergone a difficult period in the last few years and loan loss provisions were expected to remain high, "the bank expects to report significantly improved performance in 1997."
"Furthermore the agreement reached recently with Banco Ambrosiano Veneto should allow for a more diversified group and should lead to positive results especially in the medium term," it said.
Cariplo and Ambroveneto have agreed to merge to create Italy's second biggest banking group in terms of assets, deposits and loans.
